samples.name: Dynamic Side Content
samples.description: Attaches side content area which is next to the main content of the page on larger screens taking different ratios between the two on different screen sizes and on phone size screens the side content area falls down under the main content area. Best viewed in full screen.

samples.name: Dynamic Side Content - equal split mode
samples.description: The side content and the main content take 50%/50% of the container on all screen sizes except on phone screens where there is a button implemented to toggle between each other.

samples.name: Dynamic Side Content - product page
samples.description: Product page with comments example.

samples.name: Dynamic Side Content - position
samples.description: The side content is positioned on the left side of the main content in left-to-right mode and on the right side of the main content in right-to-left mode.

samples.name: Fullscreen
samples.description: This is an example of a form with one single group on a fullscreen app using the Form control

samples.name: Fullscreen with width adaption on wide screens
samples.description: This is an example of a form with one single group on a fullscreen app using the Form control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size. Even if the form has only one single group, it is possible to give it a two columns layout to avoid too heavy stretching e.g. in XL. In this case also some more space is given to them like in M size.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group arranged in one column up to L
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app using the Form control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size.

samples.name: Splitscreen
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a split app.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group arranged in two columns from L
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app using the Form control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size. The groups are arranged in up to two columns.

samples.name: Fullscreen, one with width more than one group arranged in two columns from L
samples.description: This is an example of a two-column layout using the Form control. On large screens a two-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used, on medium screens a two -column 12:12:0 layout is used and on small screens a one-column 12:12:0 layout is used. In the second Form only one Container is used, but an empty column is displayed beside to be aligned with the first Form. The groups in both forms are arranged in up to two columns.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group and 2 columns as early as possible
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app getting two columns as early as possible.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group arranged in up to three columns
samples.description: This is an example of a three-column layout using the Form control. On extra large screens (screen size XL) a three-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used, on large and medium screens a two-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used and on small screens a one-column 12:12:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used.

samples.name: With Toolbar
samples.description: A Form that uses Toolbars as Form header and FormContainer headers.

samples.name: Horizontal Layout
samples.description: The Horizontal Layout control is a simple way to align multiple controls horizontally. By default the contained controls are not wrapped. If you want more sophisticated layout options, consider Grid or Flex Box based layouts.

samples.name: Vertical Layout
samples.description: The Vertical Layout control is a simple way to align multiple controls vertically. If you want more sophisticated layout options, consider Grid or Flex Box based layouts.

samples.name: Fullscreen
samples.description: This is an example of a form with one single group on a fullscreen app using the SimpleForm control

samples.name: Fullscreen with width adaption on wide screens
samples.description: This is an example of a form with one single group on a fullscreen app using the SimpleForm control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size. Even if the form has only one single group, it is possible to give it a two columns layout to avoid too heavy stretching e.g. in XL. In this case also some more space is given to them like in M size.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group arranged in one column up to L
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app using the SimpleForm control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size.

samples.name: Splitscreen
samples.description: This is an example of a single-column 4:7:1 layout (label:input:emptyspace) using the SimpleForm control

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group arranged in two columns from L
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app using the SimpleForm control that has longer labels and fields so that some more space is given to them in M size. The groups are arranged in up to two columns.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one group arranged in up to three columns
samples.description: This is an example of a three-column layout using the SimpleForm control. On extra large screens (screen size XL) a three-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used, on large and medium screens a two-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used and on small screens a one-column 12:12:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used.

samples.name: Fullscreen, one with width more than one  group arranged in up to two columns from L
samples.description:
This is an example of a two-column layout using the SimpleForm control.
On large screens a two-column 4:8:0 layout (label:input:emptyspace) is used, on medium screens a two -column 12:12:0 layout is used and on small screens a one-column 12:12:0 layout is used. In the second SimpleForm only one Container is used, but an empty column is displayed beside to be aligned with the first SimpleForm. The groups in both forms are arranged in up to two columns.

samples.name: Fullscreen with width more than one  group and 2 columns as early as possible
samples.description: This is an example of a form with more than one group on a fullscreen app getting two columns as early as possible.

samples.name: With Toolbar
samples.description: A SimpleForm that uses Toolbars as Form header and FormContainer headers.

samples.name: Fix Flex - Vertical Direction
samples.description: Shows a FixFlex control with a vertical layout.

samples.name: Fix Flex - Horizontal Direction
samples.description: Shows a FixFlex control with a horizontal layout.

samples.name: Fix Flex - Fix container size
samples.description: Shows a FixFlex control where fixContentSize is set to a specific value(200px) and sap.m.scrollContainer is enabling vertical scrolling.

samples.name: Fix Flex - Vertical Direction with minFlexSize
samples.description: Shows a FixFlex control where the minFlexSize is set to 400px.

samples.name: Grid - Info Layout
samples.description: You can use the Grid control to make responsive table-free layouts; here we are using a default indent and span, and specifying the Small settings such that the image and text will stack on a small display.

samples.name: Grid - Tile-based Layout
samples.description: There is a lot of flexibility with the Grid control's content; here we are using Object List Items to represent products, with some being third/half-width, and others being half/full-width, depending on the available screen size.

samples.name: Grid - Task Display
samples.description: Using the Grid control, with appropriate values for the Large/Medium/Small span settings, you can set some elements to be fixed (like the Active, Inactive and Failed titles here) and some to flow.

samples.name: Grid - Features Demo
samples.description: The major layout features of the Grid control are shown in this example. Features like indentation, making content visible/invisible based on the screen size, moving content forward and backwards are demonstrated.

samples.name: Splitter Layout
samples.description: Splitter where you can change contentAreas and their sizes live

samples.name: Splitter Layout - 2 areas
samples.description: Simple splitter example with two content areas

samples.name: Splitter Layout - 2 non-resizable areas
samples.description: Simple splitter example with two content areas that cannot be resized

samples.name: Splitter Layout - 3 areas
samples.description: Simple splitter example with with three content areas

samples.name: Nested Splitter Layouts - 7 Areas
samples.description: Nested Splitter example with 7 content areas

samples.name: Block Layout
samples.description: The Block Layout  is intended to be used with rows and cells. The cells have predefined width, the rows have predefined rendering modes - scrollable/vertical/horizontal.

samples.name: Responsive Splitter
samples.description: ResponsiveSplitter is used to visually divide the content of its parent. It consists of PaneContainers that further  agregate other PaneContainers and SplitPanes. SplitPanes can be moved to the pagination when a minimum width of their parent is reached.
